Class CrownAndAnchor

  • java.lang.Object
    • CrownAndAnchor

  • public class CrownAndAnchor
extends java.lang.Object

    Crown and Anchor

    The CrownAndAnchor class is the functional back-end of Crown and Anchor. The class handles the logic and work behind the GUI by making three dice objects, rolling those dice, inputs bets into an array from the GUI, and calculates the result of the bet.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Euan Wilkinson, ID S5083285

    • Method Detail

      • rollDice

        public void rollDice()
        Handles rolling the three dice and determining their results. Also determines the payout received due to those results and sets a flag used to determine feedback in the GUI.

      • setBetArray

        public void setBetArray(int inHearts,
                        int inCrown,
                        int inDiamonds,
                        int inSpades,
                        int inAnchor,
                        int inClubs)
        Places bets from the GUI into an array for the game.
        Parameters:
        inHearts - the bet taken from the text box for the heart symbol in the GUI
        inCrown - the bet taken from the text box for the crown symbol in the GUI
        inDiamonds - the bet taken from the text box for the diamond symbol in the GUI
        inSpades - the bet taken from the text box for the spades symbol in the GUI
        inAnchor - the bet taken from the text box for the anchor symbol in the GUI
        inClubs - the bet taken from the text box for the clubs symbol in the GUI
